author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Warmest Canadian summer in 76 years: A look back at southern Alberta’s big weather stories of 2023
text:
Summary by Ground News 2023 was certainly a year for the record books when it comes to significant weather that impacted southern Alberta. The Insurance Bureau of Canada says four major storms, including Calgary’s hail storm during Stampede, cost about $300 million in insurance damage this year. A tornado that set down on July 1 was among the most powerful in years in southern Alberta and killed one person. Share menu More
